items.sentence: In this area, all of us only drink bottled water.
Tom drank a glass of white wine, and so did Mary.
Tom ordered a drink for himself and one for Mary.
Your way of doing that is much better than Tom's.
What I want is for you to tell me how to do that.
What I want is for Tom to admit that he did that.
We need to reduce our dependence on fossil fuels.
Tom still hopes that he'll be allowed to do that.
I hope that both Tom and Mary get what they want.
There's still no French translation of this book.
Tom's ex-wife wants to ruin his new relationship.
Does anybody have a logical explanation for this?
The church is midway between your house and mine.
Tom suggested I stay in Boston for another month.
I didn't pay any attention to what Tom was doing.
Tom told his son getting a tattoo was a bad idea.
It's a good thing that Tom was there to help you.
I'm glad that you were able to do that yesterday.
I don't want to do anything that would upset Tom.
Mary is cute, but I don't think she's very smart.
